tips.title: Hydration Tip
tips.content: Stay hydrated throughout the day — aim for half your body weight in ounces of water daily.

tips.title: Anti-Inflammatory Foods
tips.content: Consider an anti-inflammatory diet rich in leafy greens, berries, and omega-3 fatty acids.

tips.title: Sugar Warning
tips.content: Avoid processed sugar and refined carbs as they can worsen inflammation and fatigue.

tips.title: Snack Preparation
tips.content: Keep healthy snacks nearby to avoid energy crashes when you're too tired to cook.

tips.title: Morning Routine
tips.content: Create a morning routine that includes 5–10 minutes of mindfulness or deep breathing.

tips.title: Energy Boundaries
tips.content: Practice saying 'no' — energy is a limited resource for those with chronic conditions.

tips.title: Journaling Benefits
tips.content: Journal regularly to release mental stress and track your emotional triggers.

tips.title: Community Support
tips.content: Don't isolate — connect with a support group online or in your community.

tips.title: Gentle Movement
tips.content: Try gentle movement like stretching or yoga, even from bed if needed.

tips.title: Exercise in Chunks
tips.content: Break exercise into short chunks — even 5 minutes counts.

tips.title: Mobility Aids
tips.content: Use mobility aids if they help you stay active longer without pain.

tips.title: Listen to Your Body
tips.content: Always listen to your body and rest when needed — pacing is key.

tips.title: Symptom Tracking
tips.content: Keep a symptom tracker to identify what makes symptoms better or worse.

tips.title: Heat/Cold Therapy
tips.content: Apply heat or cold packs to painful areas, based on what your body responds to.

tips.title: Sleep Positions
tips.content: Experiment with sleep positions or support pillows for better rest.

tips.title: Flare-Up Kit
tips.content: Have a flare-up kit with meds, snacks, water, and distractions like coloring books or music.

tips.title: Doctor Visit Prep
tips.content: Bring a written list of symptoms and questions to each doctor visit.

tips.title: Health Records
tips.content: Ask for copies of all lab work and imaging so you can build your own health file.

tips.title: Second Opinions
tips.content: Don't be afraid to get a second (or third) opinion if you feel unheard.

tips.title: Medication Tracking
tips.content: Track your medication side effects and report anything unusual.

tips.title: Workplace Accommodations
tips.content: Request workplace accommodations under the ADA, such as remote work or longer breaks.

tips.title: Reminder Alarms
tips.content: Use alarms or timers to remind yourself to take breaks and drink water.

tips.title: Scheduled Rest
tips.content: Plan rest days into your calendar just like appointments.

tips.title: Meal Prep Strategy
tips.content: Prepare meals in bulk on good days and freeze them for flares.
